datafield.subfield: Shelfmark: Ann Arbor, University of Michigan, Special Collections Library, Isl. Ms. 572
Origin: As appears in colophon on p.258, transcription completed 1011 [1602 or 3].
Accompanying materials: Acquisitions slip from Yahuda.
Former shelfmark: From interior of upper cover and spine label "IL 268" (likely supplied by Yahuda, see acquisitions slip).

Binding: Pasteboards covered in marbled paper (in yellow, dark blue, green etc.) with dark red leather over spine and fore edge flap ; Type II binding (with flap) ; board linings in untinted laid paper ; sewn in blue thread, two stations ; worked chevron endbands in blue and cream (or light yellow), fairly good condition ; overall in somewhat poor condition with much abrasion and staining, lifting and losses of paper and leather, delamination of boards, etc.

Support: European laid paper of perhaps several types ; one type with 7 laid lines per cm. (vertical), chain lines spaced 25-28 mm. apart (horizontal), and anchor in circle watermark (see p.48, 49 ,et c.) ; another type with 12 laid lines per cm. (vertical), chain lines spaced 24 mm. apart (horizontal), and odd mark (possibly crustacean, scorpion or eagle, see p.42, 56, 130, etc.) ; staining and tide lines ; mends (to cover holes) in leaves carrying pp.113-128.
Decoration: Keywords and section headings rubricated ; overlining in red ; written area of opening quires (i.e. from opening through p.83) surrounded by red rule-border.

Script: Nastaʻlīq (talik) ; elegant Turkish hand ; virtually serifless with marked tilt to the right, only very slight effect of words descending to baseline, elongation of horizontal strokes, pointing in strokes rather than distinct dots, free assimilation of letters.
Layout: Written in 19 lines per page ; frame-ruled.
Collation: 13 V(130) ; exclusively quinions ; catchwords present ; pagination in pencil, Western numerals, supplied during digitization (mistakenly skips two pages between p.29 and p.30).
Colophon: "Scribal," reads "تمت الكتاب بعون الله تعالى وحسن توفيقه قد وقع فراغ هذه النسخة المباركة على يد اضعف عباد الله واحقره المحتاج الى رحمته سنة عشر واحدى والف"
Explicit: "وقد اجتمع لام كل منهما عشرون ولبنت ستون ولمولاه عشرون [عشرة] والله اعلم بالصواب"

Incipit: "الحمد لله رب العالمين وصلى الله على خير خلقه محمد واله اجمعين قال الشيخ الامام سراج الملة والدين محمد بن عبد الرشيد السجاوندي نوره الله مرقده بعد ما تيمن بالتسمية الحمد لله حمد الشاكرين والصلوة على خير البرية ... تعلمو الفرائض وعلموها الناس فانها نصف العلم هكذا رواية الفقهاء فالفرائض جمع فريضة وهي ما قدر من السهام في الميراث وانما جعل العلم بها نصف العلم اما لاختصاصها باحدى حالتي الانسان ..."

Clear copy of the commentary by ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad al-Jurjānī, al-Sayyid al-Sharīf, (d.1413) on the celebrated work on the law of inheritance by Sirāj al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Sajāwandī (fl. 12th cent.).
Acquired in 1926 from the bookseller Isaac Benjamin S.E. Yahuda via purchase transacted on his behalf by Abraham Shalom Yahuda (1877-1951), his younger brother.

Former owners' marks on repaired 'title page' (p.1) include a few statements in Turkish (nearly effaced) and kabīkaj invocation (also partially effaced) reads "يا كبيكج" ; occasional glosses and marginal corrections.
Sajāwandī, Sirāj al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad,
